other_tests.findings: Changes characteristic of diffuse proliferative lupus nephritis (class IV) and membranous lupus nephritis (class V), with moderate activity and moderate chronicity.
A large, irregular mass encasing the posterior leaflet of the mitral valve resulting in severely reduced leaflet mobility and a mean diastolic transmitral gradient of 16 mm Hg.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Reduction in the size of the mass and a decrease in the mean diastolic mitral gradient to 6.9 mm Hg 11 months after initial presentation.

other_tests.findings: A mass extending into the left atrium and left ventricle.
3+ protein and 2 to 5 red cells per high-power field.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Urinary protein excretion was less than 500 mg in 24 hours after treatment.
